item.title: Ask more questions plz
item.dc:creator: @sinisoul sini
item.description:
@sinisoul wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:17, topic:403352”]Ya, just a guess based on what I’ve seen in game. Never actually looked at it.

[quote author=super_ link=topic=500411.msg3664394#msg3664394 date=1310526846]

how do stairs work in runescape? like the ones in castle wars where you don’t actual travel up a level you just walk up.

there is a bit flag set in tile “attributes” used for this which is also used for bridges e.g. the one in lumbridge
[/quote]what does the bit represent though?[/quote]

To flag it as a bridge or incline most likely. Because when you are walking on a bridge you are positioned higher on the Y axis as compared to normally walking on landscape.

Read full topic

item.title: Ask more questions plz
item.dc:creator: @Jython super_
item.description:
@Jython wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:9, topic:403352”][quote author=super_ link=topic=500411.msg3660944#msg3660944 date=1310350934]

What is the point in having custom data types (SMART, specialA/C, etc)?

smart is interesting
the way it works is by using a size flag bit to determine the bit width, either a 7- or 15-bits
the flag is the MSB and if isn’t set it reads 7-bits but if it is it reads 15-bits
the - 32768 is to strip the flag bit from the output (100000000000000 = 2^15 = 32768)
[/quote]Oh wow, I’d seen that in my source before but never understood why it was there… thanks for the explanation[/quote]
np more questions are welcome

Read full topic

item.title: Ask more questions plz
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:

[quote=“super_, post:8, topic:403352”][quote author=T4_ link=topic=500411.msg3659660#msg3659660 date=1310268139]
What is the point in having custom data types (SMART, specialA/C, etc)?
[/quote]

smart is interesting
the way it works is by using a size flag bit to determine the bit width, either a 7- or 15-bits
the flag is the MSB and if isn’t set it reads 7-bits but if it is it reads 15-bits
the - 32768 is to strip the flag bit from the output (100000000000000 = 2^15 = 32768)[/quote]Oh wow, I’d seen that in my source before but never understood why it was there… thanks for the explanation

Read full topic

item.title: Ask more questions plz
item.dc:creator: @Jython super_
item.description:
@Jython wrote:

T4_:

What is the point in having custom data types (SMART, specialA/C, etc)?

smart is interesting
the way it works is by using a size flag bit to determine the bit width, either a 7- or 15-bits
the flag is the MSB and if isn’t set it reads 7-bits but if it is it reads 15-bits
the - 32768 is to strip the flag bit from the output (100000000000000 = 2^15 = 32768)
the reason one version uses - 64 and - 49152 is because it uses a two’s complement system for signed integers where the MSB of the 7- or 15-bit integer is a sign flag

for the other “custom data types” (- 128, 128 -, and -) it’s most likely a form of obfuscation

marluxia:

Just wonderin, are there any other active communities ???

the only active rs communities are those that revolve around private servers, password stealers, or specific bots

Read full topic
